prompt.stem: A circuit is set up as shown. The power supply has negligible internal resistance. The potential difference across the 60 Ω resistor is

assets.alt: circuit with 20 Ω, 30 Ω, 60 Ω and 12 V supply

level1: Identify series and parallel parts of the circuit from the diagram.
level2: Combine the 20 Ω and 30 Ω resistors in parallel to find an equivalent resistance, then use the potential divider across the series combination with the 60 Ω resistor.

level3.content: 20 Ω and 30 Ω in parallel: R_p = (20×30)/(20+30) = 12 Ω.
R_p (12 Ω) is in series with 60 Ω across 12 V, so V_60 = 12 × 60/(60+12).
V_60 = 10 V (option E). Unit check: volts.

common_errors: Treating the 20 Ω and 30 Ω resistors as series instead of parallel
Forgetting to use a potential divider once the equivalent resistance is found
